title: Authorizes county clerks to retain a portion of fees collected for motor vehicle related services
summary: Authorizes county clerks to retain a portion of fees collected for motor vehicle related services through a department of motor vehicles' website or the Utica processing center.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3368

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  RUSSELL, SCHROEDER, GUNTHER, JAFFEE, CASTRO,
         MAGEE -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of  A.  AMEDORE,  BARCLAY,  CALHOUN,
         CROUCH,  FINCH, GIGLIO, HAWLEY, HAYES, HOOPER, KOLB, LIFTON, P. LOPEZ,
         LUPARDO, MOLINARO, MONTESANO, OAKS, REILICH, SAYWARD,  SCHIMMINGER  --
         read once and referred to the Committee on Governmental Employees

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to allowing
         county clerks to retain  fees  collected  for  motor  vehicle  related
         services through a department of motor vehicles' website or processing
         center

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 of section 205 of  the  vehicle  and  traffic
    2  law,  as  amended  by  section  3 of part G of chapter 59 of the laws of
    3  2008, is amended to read as follows:
    4    3. (A) Each such county clerk shall retain from fees collected for any
    5  motor vehicle related service  described  in  subdivision  one  of  this
    6  section  processed  by such county clerk an amount based on a percentage
    7  of gross receipts collected. For purposes  of  this  section,  the  term
    8  "gross  receipts"  shall include all fines, fees and penalties collected
    9  pursuant to this chapter by a  county  clerk  acting  as  agent  of  the
   10  commissioner  OR  DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES' WEBSITE OR DEPARTMENT OF
   11  MOTOR VEHICLES' UTICA PROCESSING CENTER, but shall not include any state
   12  or local sales or compensating use taxes imposed under  or  pursuant  to
   13  the  authority  of  articles twenty-eight and twenty-nine of the tax law
   14  and collected by such clerk OR DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES' WEBSITE  OR
   15  DEPARTMENT  OF  MOTOR VEHICLES' UTICA PROCESSING CENTER on behalf of the
   16  commissioner of taxation and finance. The retention percentage shall  be
   17  12.7  percent  and shall take effect April first, nineteen hundred nine-
   18  ty-nine; provided, however, the retention  percentage  shall  be  thirty
   19  percent  of the thirty dollar fee established in paragraph (e) of subdi-

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01048-01-1

       A. 3368                             2

    1  vision two of section four  hundred  ninety-one  and  paragraph  [f-one]
    2  (F-1) of subdivision two of section five hundred three of this chapter.
    3    (B)  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  REMIT ON A QUARTERLY BASIS TO EACH SUCH
    4  COUNTY CLERK FROM FEES COLLECTED FOR ANY MOTOR VEHICLE  RELATED  SERVICE
    5  DESCRIBED  IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION THAT ARE PROCESSED THROUGH
    6  THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES' WEBSITE OR DEPARTMENT OF  MOTOR  VEHI-
    7  CLES' UTICA PROCESSING CENTER THE RETENTION PERCENTAGE OF GROSS RECEIPTS
    8  COLLECTED, AS SUCH RETENTION PERCENTAGE IS DESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPH (A) OF
    9  THIS  SUBDIVISION  WHICH  SUCH  COUNTY CLERK WOULD HAVE BEEN ENTITLED TO
   10  RETAIN PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION IF SUCH FEES HAD BEEN  PROCESSED  IN
   11  THE COUNTY OF RECORD OF THE REGISTRANT.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect April 1, 2012; provided, however, that
   13  effective immediately, the addition, amendment and/or repeal of any rule
   14  or regulation necessary for the implementation of this act on its effec-
   15  tive  date  are  authorized  and directed to be made and completed on or
   16  before such effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to allowing county clerks to retain fees collected for motor vehicle related services through a department of motor vehicles' website or processing center
